meanings.sent1: The school's renovation project took three trienniums to complete.
meanings.sent2: She had been working at the company for two trienniums.
meanings.sent3: The trienniums seemed to fly by, just like that!
meanings.sent4: The growth of a tree can be compared to the passing of trienniums.
meanings.sent5: The trienniums of drought made the farmers' struggle even more challenging.

meanings.definition: The plural form of triennium, meaning a period of three years.
meanings.sent1: The history books were filled with tales of ancient trienniums.
meanings.sent2: They celebrated their anniversaries every three trienniums.
meanings.sent3: The trienniums on the calendar seemed to multiply overnight!
meanings.sent4: The trienniums of peace were followed by years of turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The trienniums of plenty were a welcome relief after years of scarcity.
